Health & medicine




 

Stanford Medicine — April 26, 2023
Why won’t people take their statins?
Stanford Medicine researchers used AI to analyze online discussions related to the life-saving cholesterol drug and found a troubling amount of negativity and misinformation.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — April 25, 2023
Antibiotics after breast cancer linked to poorer survival
Triple-negative breast cancer patients who took more than one course of antibiotics after diagnosis were found to have an increased risk of death. The gut microbiome is a likely link.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — April 17, 2023
Vaccine could improve herd immunity around the world
A low-cost COVID-19 vaccine that doesn’t require refrigeration was found to provide immunity in rhesus monkeys for one year.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — March 28, 2023
How to talk to children about mass shootings
Stanford Medicine child and adolescent psychologists on helping kids process tragedy.
Read More




 

Stanford News — March 23, 2023
Wastewater could be key to tracking more viruses than just COVID-19
Researchers have developed methods for using wastewater to track the levels of various respiratory viruses in a population. This can provide real-time information about virus circulation in a community.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — March 17, 2023
Runaway immune reactions cause long COVID breathing problems
Stanford Medicine researchers have found a mechanism behind one of the most common symptoms of long COVID – shortness of breath.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — March 10, 2023
A faster heart rate can generate anxiety
A study from the Deisseroth lab addresses a question that has intrigued philosophers and scientists for more than a century: whether bodily sensations follow emotion, or the other way around.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine — March 9, 2023
A gun safety course for physicians
An online course trains doctors to reduce firearm injuries and deaths by talking to patients about safe storage.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine magazine — March 9, 2023
Longevity’s secret sauce
A way of life that keeps cells young in one region of Costa Rica.
Read More




 

Stanford Medicine magazine — March 9, 2023
Keeping breast cancer secret
For South Asian women, stigma stands in the way of asking for support.
Read More
